principle_desc_cn: 圆台的表面积由三个部分组成：上底面积\(\pi r_1^2\)、下底面积\(\pi r_2^2\)、侧面积\(\pi (r_1 + r_2) l\)（
principle_desc_en: The surface area of a frustum of a cone consists of three parts: the area of the upper base \(\pi r_1^2\), the area of the lower base \(\pi r_2^2\), and the lateral area \(\pi (r_1 + r_2) l\) (

kp_en: Volume of Frustum of a Cone
principle_desc_cn: 计算圆台体积的方法为截头圆锥法，设原圆锥高度\(H\)，截去小圆锥高度\(H-h\)，由相似比\(\frac{H}{r_2} = \frac{H-h}{r_1}\)解得\(H = \frac{h r_2}{r_2 - r_1}\)，体积\(V = \frac{1}{3}\pi r_2^2 H - \frac{1}{3}\pi r_1^2 (H-h)\)
principle_desc_en: The method for calculating the volume of a frustum is the truncated cone method. Let the original cone have height \(H\), and the small cone that is cut off have height \(H-h\). By the similarity ratio \(\frac{H}{r_2} = \frac{H-h}{r_1}\), we solve to get \(H = \frac{h r_2}{r_2 - r_1}\). The volume is \(V = \frac{1}{3}\pi r_2^2 H - \frac{1}{3}\pi r_1^2 (H-h)\).

kp_en: Volume of Frustum of a Cone
principle_desc_cn: 圆台体积的公式符号表示为\(V = \frac{1}{3} \pi h (r_1^2 + r_2^2 + r_1 r_2)\)（如\(h=4\text{m}, r_1=2\text{m}, r_2=5\text{m}\)时，\(V=\frac{1}{3}\pi \times4\times(4+25+10)=\frac{156}{3}\pi=52\pi\text{m}^3\)）
principle_desc_en: The formula for the volume of a frustum of a cone is symbolically expressed as \(V = \frac{1}{3} \pi h (r_1^2 + r_2^2 + r_1 r_2)\) (for example, when \(h=4\text{m}, r_1=2\text{m}, r_2=5\text{m}\), \(V=\frac{1}{3}\pi \times4\times(4+25+10)=\frac{156}{3}\pi=52\pi\text{m}^3\)).

kp_en: Volume of Frustum of a Cone
principle_desc_cn: 圆台体积实际运用包括粮仓容积测算、圆台形酒杯容量设计等
principle_desc_en: Practical applications of the volume of a frustum of a cone include calculating the storage capacity of grain silos and designing the capacity of frustum-shaped wine glasses.

kp_en: Structural Features of Frustum of a Cone
principle_en: Upper and Lower Bases of Frustum
principle_desc_cn: 圆台的上下底面是两个大小不同且相似的圆，且相互平行（数学条件：\(r_2 = k r_1\)，其中\(k \neq 1\)为缩放比例）
principle_desc_en: The upper and lower bases of a frustum of a cone are two circles of different sizes that are similar and parallel to each other (mathematical condition: \(r_2 = k r_1\), where \(k \neq 1\) is the scaling factor).

kp_en: Structural Features of Frustum of a Cone
principle_desc_cn: 圆台的轴是连接上下底面圆心\(O_1\)和\(O_2\)的线段，长度等于圆台高\(h\)，满足垂直性条件\(\overrightarrow{O_1O_2} \perp \text{底面}\)
principle_desc_en: The axis of a frustum of a cone is the line segment connecting the centers \(O_1\) and \(O_2\) of the upper and lower bases, with a length equal to the height \(h\) of the frustum, satisfying the perpendicularity condition \(\overrightarrow{O_1O_2} \perp \text{base}\).

kp_en: Structural Features of Frustum of a Cone
principle_desc_cn: 圆台的母线是所有侧棱的集合，长度均为\(l = \sqrt{h^2 + (r_2 - r_1)^2}\)（由勾股定理推导，如\(r_1=3\text{cm}, r_2=5\text{cm}, h=4\text{cm}\)时\(l= \sqrt{16 +4}=2\sqrt{5}\text{cm}\)）
principle_desc_en: The slant height (generator) of a frustum of a cone is the set of all lateral edges, each having a length of \(l = \sqrt{h^2 + (r_2 - r_1)^2}\) (derived from the Pythagorean theorem; for example, when \(r_1=3\text{cm}, r_2=5\text{cm}, h=4\text{cm}\), then \(l= \sqrt{16 + 4}=2\sqrt{5}\text{cm}\)).

kp_en: Structural Features of Frustum of a Cone
principle_desc_cn: 圆台的侧面侧面为旋转曲面，展开后扇环圆心角\(\theta = \frac{2\pi(r_2 - r_1)}{l}\)
principle_desc_en: The lateral surface of a frustum of a cone is a surface of revolution. When unfolded, the central angle of the sector is \(\theta = \frac{2\pi(r_2 - r_1)}{l}\).

kp_en: Structural Features of Frustum of a Cone
principle_desc_cn: 所有母线的反向延长线交于圆锥顶点\(V\)，满足相似比\(\frac{VO_1}{VO_2} = \frac{r_1}{r_2}\)（如截头圆锥高度\(H = \frac{h r_2}{r_2 - r_1}\)）
principle_desc_en: The backward extensions of all generatrices intersect at the vertex \(V\) of the cone, satisfying the similarity ratio \(\frac{VO_1}{VO_2} = \frac{r_1}{r_2}\) (for example, the height of the frustum of the cone \(H = \frac{h r_2}{r_2 - r_1}\)).

kp_en: Structural Features of Frustum of a Cone
principle_desc_cn: 圆台结构特征的实际运用包括冷却塔双曲面结构、圆台形花瓶造型设计等
principle_desc_en: The practical applications of the structural features of a frustum of a cone include the hyperboloid structure of cooling towers and the design of frustum-shaped vases.

kp_en: Structural Features of Frustum of a Cone
principle_desc_cn: 生活中的圆台为在生活中运用立体几何圆台的知识解决生活实际问题
principle_desc_en: Frustums of a cone in daily life refer to applying the knowledge of solid geometry regarding frustums of a cone to solve practical problems in everyday life.

kp_en: Structural Features of Frustum of a Cone
principle_desc_cn: 直角梯形绕垂直于底边的腰旋转一周形成圆台（如绕高旋转）
principle_desc_en: A right trapezoid rotates one full turn about the leg perpendicular to its base to form a frustum of a cone (such as rotation about the height).

kp_en: Section of Frustum of a Cone
principle_desc_cn: 圆台平行于底面的截面所得圆半径\(r_x = r_1 + \frac{x}{h}(r_2 - r_1)\)（\(x\)为截面到底面距离
principle_desc_en: The radius of the circle obtained by a section of a frustum of a cone parallel to the base is \(r_x = r_1 + \frac{x}{h}(r_2 - r_1)\), where \(x\) is the distance from the section to the base.

kp_en: Section of Frustum of a Cone
principle_desc_cn: 圆台轴截面为等腰梯形，两底边长为\(2r_1\)和\(2r_2\)，腰长为母线\(l\)，高为圆台高\(h\)（面积公式：\(S_{\text{轴截面}} = \frac{1}{2}(2r_1 + 2r_2)h = h(r_1 + r_2)\)）
principle_desc_en: The axial section of a frustum of a cone is an isosceles trapezoid, with the lengths of the two bases being \(2r_1\) and \(2r_2\), the length of each leg being the slant height \(l\), and the height being the height of the frustum \(h\) (area formula: \(S_{\text{axial section}} = \frac{1}{2}(2r_1 + 2r_2)h = h(r_1 + r_2)\)).

kp_en: Section of Frustum of a Cone
principle_desc_cn: 圆台过两条母线\(AA'\)和\(BB'\)的平面截得等腰梯形\(ABB'A'\)，其高为\(h\)，底角\(\alpha = \arctan\left(\frac{r_2 - r_1}{h}\right)\)
principle_desc_en: A plane passing through two generators \(AA'\) and \(BB'\) of a frustum of a cone cuts out an isosceles trapezoid \(ABB'A'\), whose height is \(h\), and whose base angle \(\alpha = \arctan\left(\frac{r_2 - r_1}{h}\right)\).

kp_en: Section of Frustum of a Cone
principle_desc_cn: 机械零件强度分析（轴截面应力分布）、地质岩层截面采样
principle_desc_en: Mechanical component strength analysis (stress distribution on shaft cross-section), geological rock layer cross-section sampling

kp_en: Shortest Path on the Surface of Frustum of a Cone
principle_desc_cn: 圆台将侧面展开为扇环形，圆心角\(\theta = \frac{2\pi(r_2 - r_1)}{l}\)，外弧半径\(R = l + r_1\)，内弧半径\(r = r_1\)。展开图上点\(P\)（对应圆台上底边缘点）到点\(Q\)（对应下底边缘点）的直线距离\(d = \sqrt{R^2 + r^2 - 2Rr \cos\theta}\),特殊情况：当两点位于母线上时最短路径即母线本身
principle_desc_en: The lateral surface of the frustum of a cone is unfolded into a circular ring sector, with central angle \(\theta = \frac{2\pi(r_2 - r_1)}{l}\), outer arc radius \(R = l + r_1\), and inner arc radius \(r = r_1\). On the unfolded figure, the straight-line distance \(d\) from point \(P\) (corresponding to a point on the upper base edge of the frustum) to point \(Q\) (corresponding to a point on the lower base edge) is \(d = \sqrt{R^2 + r^2 - 2Rr \cos\theta}\). Special case: when the two points are located on the same generatrix, the shortest path is the generatrix itself.

principle_desc_cn: 棱柱是由两个全等且边数相等的多边形作为上下底面，通过一组平行四边形（直棱柱为矩形）侧面连接而成的立体图形
principle_desc_en: A prism is a solid figure formed by two congruent polygons with the same number of sides as the top and bottom bases, connected by a set of parallelogram (rectangular for a right prism) lateral faces.

principle_desc_cn: 棱柱分为：直棱柱（侧棱垂直底面，侧面为矩形）、斜棱柱（侧棱倾斜，侧面为平行四边形）、正棱柱（底面为正多边形的直棱柱）
principle_desc_en: Prisms are classified as follows: right prism (the lateral edges are perpendicular to the base, and the lateral faces are rectangles), oblique prism (the lateral edges are inclined, and the lateral faces are parallelograms), regular prism (a right prism whose base is a regular polygon).

principle_desc_cn: 棱柱的几何特性包括平行六面体是底面为平行四边形的棱柱，长方体是底面为矩形的直棱柱
principle_desc_en: The geometric properties of prisms include that a parallelepiped is a prism whose base is a parallelogram, and a rectangular cuboid is a right prism whose base is a rectangle.

principle_desc_cn: 根据棱柱的定义判断立体几何体是否为棱柱，以及是否属于特殊棱柱，注意上下底面是否为平行且全等的多边形
principle_desc_en: According to the definition of a prism, determine whether a solid figure is a prism and whether it is a special type of prism. Pay attention to whether the top and bottom faces are parallel and congruent polygons.

principle_cn: 棱柱展开图的形状和规律
principle_en: Shape and Pattern of Prism Net
principle_desc_cn: 棱柱由两个全等的n边形底面和n个矩形（直棱柱）或平行四边形（斜棱柱）侧面组成，侧面展开后形成连续矩形带（总长度=底面周长\(P\)，宽度=侧棱长\(h\)），直棱柱展开侧面为矩形带（如长方体展开图含6个矩形），斜三棱柱展开含2个三角形和3个平行四边形
principle_desc_en: A prism consists of two congruent n-sided polygonal bases and n lateral faces, which are rectangles (for a right prism) or parallelograms (for an oblique prism). When the lateral faces are unfolded, they form a continuous strip of rectangles (total length = perimeter of the base \(P\), width = height of the lateral edge \(h\)). The unfolded lateral faces of a right prism form a rectangular strip (for example, the net of a rectangular cuboid contains 6 rectangles). The net of an oblique triangular prism contains 2 triangles and 3 parallelograms.

principle_desc_cn: 棱柱展开图的应用包括包装盒设计（最小材料计算）、金属框架下料（展开尺寸优化）
principle_desc_en: Applications of the prism net include packaging box design (minimum material calculation) and metal frame cutting (optimization of unfolded dimensions).

principle_cn: 棱柱表面积的计算公式
principle_en: Formula for Surface Area of Prism
principle_desc_cn: 总表面积\(S = 2B + Ph\)（\(B\)为底面积，\(P\)为底面周长，\(h\)为侧棱长，直棱柱中\(h\)即高度）
principle_desc_en: Total surface area \(S = 2B + Ph\) (\(B\) is the base area, \(P\) is the base perimeter, \(h\) is the lateral edge length; in a right prism, \(h\) is the height)

principle_en: Surface Area of Regular Hexagonal Prism
principle_desc_cn: 正六棱柱表面积\(S = 2 \times \frac{3\sqrt{3}}{2}a^2 + 6a \times h\)（\(a\)为底面边长）
principle_desc_en: Surface area of a regular hexagonal prism \(S = 2 \times \frac{3\sqrt{3}}{2}a^2 + 6a \times h\) (\(a\) is the side length of the base)

principle_desc_cn: \(V = B \times h\)（\(B\)为底面积，\(h\)为垂直于底面的高度，斜棱柱中需用正交投影高度\(h_{\perp} = h \cos\theta\)，\(\theta\)为侧棱与底面夹角）
principle_desc_en: \(V = B \times h\) (\(B\) is the area of the base, \(h\) is the height perpendicular to the base. In an oblique prism, the orthogonal projection height \(h_{\perp} = h \cos\theta\) should be used, where \(\theta\) is the angle between the lateral edge and the base.)

principle_desc_cn: 桥梁墩柱混凝土用量估算、仓库储物空间计算
principle_desc_en: Estimation of concrete usage for bridge pier columns, calculation of storage space in warehouses

principle_desc_cn: 上下底面为全等n边形（数学符号\(B_1 \cong B_2\)），保持平行且间距为高\(h\)（如正六棱柱底面边长相等、内角120°）
principle_desc_en: The upper and lower bases are congruent n-gons (mathematically denoted as \(B_1 \cong B_2\)), remain parallel, and are separated by a distance equal to the height \(h\) (for example, in a regular hexagonal prism, the base edges are equal in length and the internal angles are 120°).

principle_desc_cn: 直棱柱侧面为矩形（长=底面边长\(a_i\)，宽=高\(h\)），斜棱柱侧面为平行四边形（边长=底面边长\(a_i\)，高=侧棱投影\(h \sin\theta\)）
principle_desc_en: The lateral faces of a right prism are rectangles (length = base edge \(a_i\), width = height \(h\)), while the lateral faces of an oblique prism are parallelograms (side length = base edge \(a_i\), height = projection of the lateral edge \(h \sin\theta\)).

principle_desc_cn: 直棱柱对角线公式（如长方体空间对角线\(d=\sqrt{a^2+b^2+c^2}\)）、侧棱向量关系（斜棱柱侧棱向量\(\vec{v} = \vec{h} + \vec{t}\)含垂直与切向分量）
principle_desc_en: Diagonal formula for a right prism (such as the space diagonal of a rectangular cuboid \(d=\sqrt{a^2+b^2+c^2}\)), lateral edge vector relationship (the lateral edge vector of an oblique prism \(\vec{v} = \vec{h} + \vec{t}\) contains both vertical and tangential components)

principle_desc_cn: 棱柱结构特征的时间里包括水晶矿物晶格（斜方六面体）、大厦玻璃幕墙支撑框架（直四棱柱）等
principle_desc_en: The structural features of prisms include crystal mineral lattices (orthorhombic hexahedron), glass curtain wall support frameworks of buildings (right quadrangular prism), etc.

principle_desc_cn: 生活中的棱柱为在生活中运用立体几何棱柱的知识解决生活实际问题
principle_desc_en: Prisms in daily life refer to applying the knowledge of solid geometry prisms to solve practical problems in daily life.

principle_en: Relationship between Vertices, Edges, and Faces of Frustum
principle_desc_cn: n棱柱顶点数2n、棱数3n、面数n+2，如六棱柱为12顶点/18棱/8面
principle_desc_en: An n-gonal prism has 2n vertices, 3n edges, and n+2 faces; for example, a hexagonal prism has 12 vertices, 18 edges, and 8 faces.

principle_desc_cn: 形状与底面全等，面积\(B_x = B \times \left(\frac{x}{h}\right)^2\)（\(x\)为截面到顶点距离，仅适用于锥体截切棱柱的特殊情况）
principle_desc_en: The shape is congruent to the base, and the area \(B_x = B \times \left(\frac{x}{h}\right)^2\) (\(x\) is the distance from the section to the vertex; this is only applicable to the special case where a prism is cut by a cone).

principle_desc_cn: 沿高度方向切割得矩形（边长=底面边长的投影与高度\(h\)，如正五棱柱垂直截面为矩形宽=边长\(a\)、高=\(h\)）
principle_desc_en: A cut along the height yields a rectangle (side lengths equal to the projection of the base edge and the height \(h\); for example, the vertical section of a regular pentagonal prism is a rectangle with width equal to the side length \(a\) and height \(h\)).

principle_desc_cn: 平面与侧棱斜交得平行四边形（面积\(S = a \times h \sec\theta\)，\(\theta\)为截面与底面夹角），特殊角度可得梯形（当截面同时切割上下底面）
principle_desc_en: A plane intersecting the lateral edges of a prism obliquely forms a parallelogram (area \(S = a \times h \sec\theta\), where \(\theta\) is the angle between the section and the base); at special angles, a trapezoid is formed (when the section intersects both the top and bottom bases).

kp_en: Shortest Path on the Surface of Prism
principle_desc_cn: 展开侧面为矩形带（直棱柱）或平行四边形带（斜棱柱），起点\(A\)与终点\(B\)的二维直线距离\(d = \sqrt{(\sum a_i)^2 + h^2}\)（\(a_i\)为底面边长累加，
principle_desc_en: Unfold the lateral surface into a rectangular strip (for a right prism) or a parallelogram strip (for an oblique prism), and the two-dimensional straight-line distance between the starting point \(A\) and the endpoint \(B\) is \(d = \sqrt{(\sum a_i)^2 + h^2}\) (where \(a_i\) is the sum of the lengths of the base edges).

kp_en: Shortest Path on the Surface of Prism
principle_en: Correction of Net for Oblique Prism
principle_desc_cn: 路径计算需考虑侧棱倾斜角\(\theta\)，有效高度\(h_{\text{eff}}=h/\cos\theta\)
principle_desc_en: Path calculation needs to take into account the slant angle \(\theta\) of the lateral edge, with the effective height \(h_{\text{eff}}=h/\cos\theta\).

principle_desc_cn: 由一个n边形底面和n个三角形侧面组成的凸多面体，顶点\(V\)到底面的垂线段为高\(h\)（体积公式\(V = \frac{1}{3}Bh\)，\(B\)为底面积）
principle_desc_en: A convex polyhedron composed of an n-sided polygonal base and n triangular lateral faces, with the perpendicular segment from the vertex \(V\) to the base as the height \(h\) (volume formula \(V = \frac{1}{3}Bh\), where \(B\) is the area of the base).

principle_desc_cn: 正棱锥（底面为正多边形且高过底面中心，如正四棱锥侧棱长\(l = \sqrt{h^2 + R^2}\)，\(R\)为底面外接圆半径）、斜棱锥（顶点投影不在底面中心）
principle_desc_en: Regular pyramid (the base is a regular polygon and the height passes through the center of the base, for example, in a regular quadrilateral pyramid the lateral edge length \(l = \sqrt{h^2 + R^2}\), where \(R\) is the radius of the circumscribed circle of the base), oblique pyramid (the projection of the apex is not at the center of the base)

principle_desc_cn: 根据棱锥的定义判断立体几何体是否为棱锥，以及是否属于特殊棱锥，注意底面是否为多边形，侧面是否均为三角形
principle_desc_en: According to the definition of a pyramid, determine whether a solid geometric figure is a pyramid and whether it is a special type of pyramid. Pay attention to whether the base is a polygon and whether all lateral faces are triangles.

principle_desc_cn: 底面n边形+n个侧面三角形（正棱锥侧面为全等等腰三角形，底边=底面边长\(a\)，腰=侧棱长\(l\)）
principle_desc_en: An n-sided polygon as the base and n lateral triangular faces (for a regular pyramid, all lateral faces are congruent isosceles triangles with base equal to the side length of the base \(a\) and legs equal to the slant edge length \(l\)).

principle_desc_cn: 表面积等于底面面积加侧面面积，所有侧面为全等等腰三角形，斜高\(s = \sqrt{h^2 + r^2}\)（\(r\)为底面边心距，如正四棱锥底面边长\(a\)，则\(r = \frac{a}{2\tan(\pi/4)} = \frac{a}{2}\)）
principle_desc_en: The surface area is equal to the base area plus the lateral area. All lateral faces are congruent isosceles triangles. The slant height \(s = \sqrt{h^2 + r^2}\) (\(r\) is the apothem of the base; for a regular square pyramid with base side length \(a\), \(r = \frac{a}{2\tan(\pi/4)} = \frac{a}{2}\)).

principle_desc_cn: 各侧面三角形面积需单独计算（如底面为不规则五边形时，\(S_{\text{侧}} = \sum_{i=1}^5 \frac{1}{2} a_i s_i\)）
principle_desc_en: The area of each triangular lateral face needs to be calculated separately (for example, if the base is an irregular pentagon, \(S_{\text{lateral}} = \sum_{i=1}^5 \frac{1}{2} a_i s_i\)).

principle_desc_cn: \(V = \frac{1}{3} S_{\text{底}} h\)。斜棱锥修正：体积公式仍适用，但\(h\)必须为顶点到底面的垂直距离，如斜四棱锥需通过投影计算\(h_{\perp} = h \cos\theta\)，\(\theta\)为侧棱与底面夹角。
principle_desc_en: \(V = \frac{1}{3} S_{\text{base}} h\). Oblique pyramid adjustment: The volume formula still applies, but \(h\) must be the perpendicular distance from the apex to the base. For example, in an oblique quadrilateral pyramid, \(h_{\perp} = h \cos\theta\) should be calculated through projection, where \(\theta\) is the angle between the lateral edge and the base.

principle_en: Relationship between Base and Lateral Faces
principle_desc_cn: n边形底面连接n个三角形侧面（至少4个面，如三棱锥含4个面），构成欧拉公式\(V-E+F=2\)（顶点数\(V=n+1\)，棱数\(E=2n\)，面数\(F=n+1\)）
principle_desc_en: An n-sided polygonal base is connected with n triangular lateral faces (at least 4 faces, such as a triangular pyramid having 4 faces), forming Euler's formula \(V-E+F=2\) (number of vertices \(V=n+1\), number of edges \(E=2n\), number of faces \(F=n+1\)).

principle_desc_cn: 底面为正多边形且顶点投影为底面中心，侧棱长相等\(l = \sqrt{h^2 + R^2}\)（\(R\)为底面外接圆半径）
principle_desc_en: The base is a regular polygon and the projection of the apex is the center of the base; the lateral edges are equal in length \(l = \sqrt{h^2 + R^2}\) (\(R\) is the radius of the circumscribed circle of the base).

principle_desc_cn: 生活中的棱锥为在生活中运用立体几何棱锥的知识解决生活实际问题
principle_desc_en: Pyramids in daily life refer to using the knowledge of solid geometry pyramids to solve practical problems in daily life.

principle_en: Height and Slant Height of Pyramid
principle_desc_cn: 顶点到底面距离为高h，侧面三角形的高为斜高l_{\text{斜}}（正棱锥中l_{\text{斜}} = \sqrt{h^2 + r_{\text{内}}^2}，r_{\text{内}}为底面内切圆半径）
principle_desc_en: The distance from the apex to the base is the height h, and the height of the lateral triangular face is the slant height l_{\text{slant}} (in a regular pyramid, l_{\text{slant}} = \sqrt{h^2 + r_{\text{in}}^2}, where r_{\text{in}} is the radius of the inscribed circle of the base).

principle_cn: 棱锥平行于底面的截面
principle_en: Section of Pyramid Parallel to Base
principle_desc_cn: 截面形状与底面相似，面积比为\(\left(\frac{h_x}{h}\right)^2\)（\(h_x\)为截面到顶点高度，\(h\)为棱锥总高
principle_desc_en: The shape of the cross-section is similar to the base, and the ratio of their areas is \(\left(\frac{h_x}{h}\right)^2\), where \(h_x\) is the height from the cross-section to the vertex, and \(h\) is the total height of the pyramid.

principle_desc_cn: 过顶点与底面某边的平面截得三角形，正棱锥轴截面为等腰三角形（底边=底面边长\(a\)，腰=侧棱长\(l = \sqrt{h^2 + (\frac{a}{2})^2}\)），斜棱锥轴截面为不规则三角形
principle_desc_en: A plane passing through the apex and a side of the base cuts out a triangle. The axial section of a regular pyramid is an isosceles triangle (the base = the side length of the base \(a\), the legs = the slant edge length \(l = \sqrt{h^2 + (\frac{a}{2})^2}\)), while the axial section of an oblique pyramid is an irregular triangle.

kp_en: Shortest Path on the Surface of Pyramid
principle_desc_cn: 将n个侧面三角形沿公共边展开成扇形平面图（正棱锥展开为n个全等三角形环绕，圆心角\(\theta = \frac{2\pi}{n}\)）。路径计算：两点间展开直线距离\(d = \sqrt{(k a)^2 + h^2}\)（\(k\)为绕行底面边数，如正三棱锥底面边长4cm，绕行1边时\(d = \sqrt{4^2 + 5^2}≈6.4\text{cm}\)）。三维映射：最短路径对应侧面上的折线（如蚂蚁从底面顶点A到侧面顶点B需跨越两个三角形面）
principle_desc_en: Unfold the n lateral triangular faces along their common edges into a sector-shaped plane diagram (a regular pyramid unfolds into n congruent triangles arranged around a point, with a central angle \(\theta = \frac{2\pi}{n}\)). Path calculation: the straight-line distance between two points in the unfolded plane is \(d = \sqrt{(k a)^2 + h^2}\) (\(k\) is the number of base edges traversed; for example, for a regular triangular pyramid with base edge length 4 cm, when traversing 1 edge, \(d = \sqrt{4^2 + 5^2}≈6.4\text{cm}\)). Three-dimensional mapping: the shortest path corresponds to a broken line on the lateral faces (for example, an ant traveling from base vertex A to lateral face vertex B must cross two triangular faces).

kp_en: Shortest Path on the Surface of Pyramid
principle_desc_cn: 棱锥表面最短路径时间里包括登山路径优化（类比棱锥表面坡度）、无人机避障路径规划等
principle_desc_en: The shortest path on the surface of a pyramid is involved in scenarios such as mountain path optimization (analogous to the slope on the surface of a pyramid) and obstacle avoidance path planning for drones.

kp_en: Definition of Frustum of a Pyramid
principle_desc_cn: 由平行于棱锥底面的平面截得的立体图形为棱台，包含原底面（下底面）和截面（上底面），侧面为梯形（正棱台侧面为全等等腰梯形）。
principle_desc_en: A solid figure obtained by cutting a pyramid with a plane parallel to its base is called a frustum of a pyramid. It includes the original base (lower base) and the section (upper base), and its lateral faces are trapezoids (for a regular frustum of a pyramid, all lateral faces are congruent isosceles trapezoids).

kp_en: Definition of Frustum of a Pyramid
principle_desc_cn: 根据棱台的定义判断立体几何体是否为棱台，以及是否属于特殊棱台，注意上底和下底是否为相似且平行的多边形
principle_desc_en: According to the definition of a frustum of a pyramid, determine whether a solid geometric figure is a frustum, and whether it is a special frustum. Pay attention to whether the upper base and the lower base are similar and parallel polygons.

kp_en: Development (Net) of Frustum of a Pyramid
principle_desc_cn: 由两个相似正多边形底面和全等等腰梯形侧面组成，梯形高为斜高\(s = \sqrt{h^2 + (r_{\text{下}} - r_{\text{上}})^2}\)，展开圆心角\(\theta = \frac{2\pi(r_{\text{下}} - r_{\text{上}})}{s}\)
principle_desc_en: It consists of two similar regular polygonal bases and lateral faces that are all congruent isosceles trapezoids. The height of the trapezoid is the slant height \(s = \sqrt{h^2 + (r_{\text{lower}} - r_{\text{upper}})^2}\), and the central angle for the net is \(\theta = \frac{2\pi(r_{\text{lower}} - r_{\text{upper}})}{s}\).

kp_en: Development (Net) of Frustum of a Pyramid
principle_desc_cn: 底面和顶面为不规则多边形，侧面为不等边梯形（各梯形高度不同，需单独计算面积，如底面五边形各边差\(\Delta a_i\)，梯形高\(s_i = \sqrt{h^2 + (\Delta a_i)^2}\)）
principle_desc_en: The base and top faces are irregular polygons, and the lateral faces are trapezoids with unequal sides (the heights of the trapezoids are different and need to be calculated individually; for example, for each side of the pentagonal base, the difference of each side is \(\Delta a_i\), and the height of the trapezoid is \(s_i = \sqrt{h^2 + (\Delta a_i)^2}\)).

kp_en: Surface Area of Frustum of a Pyramid
principle_desc_cn: 底面积与顶面积：正棱台底面积\(S_{\text{下}} = n \times \frac{1}{2} a_{\text{下}} r_{\text{下}}\)（\(n\)为边数，\(r_{\text{下}}\)为边心距），顶面积\(S_{\text{上}} = k^2 S_{\text{下}}\)（\(k\)为缩放比）。侧面积计算：每个梯形面积\(\frac{1}{2}(a_{\text{上}} + a_{\text{下}}) \times s\)（正棱台）或\(\sum_{i=1}^n \frac{1}{2}(a_{i上} + a_{i下}) \times s_i\)（斜棱台），。总表面积公式：\(S = S_{\text{上}} + S_{\text{下}} + S_{\text{侧}}\)。
principle_desc_en: Base area and top area: For a regular frustum, the base area \(S_{\text{bottom}} = n \times \frac{1}{2} a_{\text{bottom}} r_{\text{bottom}}\) (\(n\) is the number of sides, \(r_{\text{bottom}}\) is the apothem of the base), and the top area \(S_{\text{top}} = k^2 S_{\text{bottom}}\) (\(k\) is the scaling ratio). Lateral area calculation: the area of each trapezoid is \(\frac{1}{2}(a_{\text{top}} + a_{\text{bottom}}) \times s\) (for a regular frustum) or \(\sum_{i=1}^n \frac{1}{2}(a_{i\text{top}} + a_{i\text{bottom}}) \times s_i\) (for an oblique frustum). The total surface area formula: \(S = S_{\text{top}} + S_{\text{bottom}} + S_{\text{lateral}}\).

kp_en: Volume of Frustum of a Pyramid
principle_desc_cn: 由棱锥体积差\(V = \frac{1}{3}h(S_{\text{下}} + S_{\text{上}} + \sqrt{S_{\text{下}}S_{\text{上}}})\)（如原棱锥高\(H\)，截得小棱锥高\(H-h\)，体积\(V = \frac{1}{3}H S_{\text{下}} - \frac{1}{3}(H-h) S_{\text{上}} = \frac{1}{3}h(S_{\text{下}} + S_{\text{上}} + \sqrt{S_{\text{下}}S_{\text{上}}})\)）。
principle_desc_en: From the volume difference of pyramids \(V = \frac{1}{3}h(S_{\text{lower}} + S_{\text{upper}} + \sqrt{S_{\text{lower}}S_{\text{upper}}})\) (for example, if the original pyramid has height \(H\), and the smaller pyramid cut off has height \(H-h\), the volume \(V = \frac{1}{3}H S_{\text{lower}} - \frac{1}{3}(H-h) S_{\text{upper}} = \frac{1}{3}h(S_{\text{lower}} + S_{\text{upper}} + \sqrt{S_{\text{lower}}S_{\text{upper}}})\)).

kp_en: Structural Features of Frustum of a Pyramid
principle_desc_cn: 棱台上下底面为相似多边形，相似比\(k = \frac{a_{\text{上}}}{a_{\text{下}}}\)（如正四棱台底面边长10cm，顶面6cm，则\(k=0.6\)），面积比\(S_{\text{上}}:S_{\text{下}}=k^2\)（如\(S_{\text{下}}=100\text{cm}^2\), \(S_{\text{上}}=36\text{cm}^2\)）
principle_desc_en: The upper and lower bases of a frustum of a pyramid are similar polygons, with a similarity ratio \(k = \frac{a_{\text{upper}}}{a_{\text{lower}}}\) (for example, if the lower base of a right square frustum has a side length of 10 cm and the upper base has a side length of 6 cm, then \(k=0.6\)). The ratio of their areas is \(S_{\text{upper}}:S_{\text{lower}}=k^2\) (for example, if \(S_{\text{lower}}=100\text{cm}^2\), \(S_{\text{upper}}=36\text{cm}^2\)).

kp_en: Structural Features of Frustum of a Pyramid
principle_desc_cn: 每个侧面为等腰梯形（正棱台）或一般梯形（斜棱台），斜高\(s = \sqrt{h^2 + (a_{\text{下}} - a_{\text{上}})^2}\)
principle_desc_en: Each lateral face is an isosceles trapezoid (regular frustum) or a general trapezoid (oblique frustum), with the slant height \(s = \sqrt{h^2 + (a_{\text{lower}} - a_{\text{upper}})^2}\).

kp_en: Structural Features of Frustum of a Pyramid
principle_desc_cn: 正棱台侧棱等长\(l = \sqrt{h^2 + (a_{\text{下}} - a_{\text{上}})^2}\)，斜棱台侧棱不等
principle_desc_en: The lateral edges of a right frustum of a pyramid are equal in length, \(l = \sqrt{h^2 + (a_{\text{lower}} - a_{\text{upper}})^2}\), while the lateral edges of an oblique frustum of a pyramid are unequal.

kp_en: Structural Features of Frustum of a Pyramid
principle_desc_cn: 垂直距离\(h\)（斜棱台中需投影修正\(h_{\perp}=h \cos\theta\)，\(\theta\)为倾斜角）
principle_desc_en: Vertical distance \(h\) (in an oblique frustum, projection correction is required: \(h_{\perp}=h \cos\theta\), where \(\theta\) is the inclination angle)

kp_en: Structural Features of Frustum of a Pyramid
principle_desc_cn: 生活中的棱台为在生活中运用立体几何棱台的知识解决生活实际问题
principle_desc_en: Frustums in daily life refer to applying the knowledge of solid geometry frustums to solve practical problems in everyday life.

kp_en: Section of Frustum of a Pyramid
principle_cn: 棱台平行于底面的平行截面
principle_en: Parallel Section of Frustum Parallel to Base
principle_desc_cn: 与底面平行的截面面积\(S_x = S_{\text{下}} \times \left(\frac{h_x}{h}\right)^2\)（\(h_x\)为截面到底面距离
principle_desc_en: The area of a section parallel to the base \(S_x = S_{\text{base}} \times \left(\frac{h_x}{h}\right)^2\), where \(h_x\) is the distance from the section to the base.

kp_en: Section of Frustum of a Pyramid
principle_desc_cn: 截得等腰梯形（正棱台）或一般梯形（斜棱台），高=棱台高\(h\)，两底边=上下底面边长
principle_desc_en: The section obtained is an isosceles trapezoid (for a right frustum) or a general trapezoid (for an oblique frustum), with height equal to the frustum height \(h\), and the two bases equal to the lengths of the upper and lower base edges.

kp_en: Section of Frustum of a Pyramid
principle_desc_cn: 平面与侧棱成\(\alpha\)角时截得五边形
principle_desc_en: A pentagon is formed when the plane intersects the lateral edge at an angle of \(\alpha\).

principle_desc_cn: 由6个矩形面围成的六面体为长方体，数学描述为\( \{ (x,y,z) | 0 \leq x \leq a, 0 \leq y \leq b, 0 \leq z \leq c \} \)（参数\(a,b,c>0\)）
principle_desc_en: A hexahedron enclosed by 6 rectangular faces is called a rectangular cuboid. Mathematically, it is described as \( \{ (x,y,z) | 0 \leq x \leq a, 0 \leq y \leq b, 0 \leq z \leq c \} \) (parameters \(a, b, c > 0\)).

principle_desc_cn: 长方体有6个面（2个\(a \times b\)，2个\(b \times c\)，2个\(a \times c\)），12条棱（4条长\(a\)，4条宽\(b\)，4条高\(c\)）
principle_desc_en: A rectangular cuboid has 6 faces (2 of \(a \times b\), 2 of \(b \times c\), 2 of \(a \times c\)), and 12 edges (4 of length \(a\), 4 of width \(b\), 4 of height \(c\)).

principle_desc_cn: 长方体有三条空间对角线，长度为\(d = \sqrt{a^2 + b^2 + c^2}\)
principle_desc_en: A rectangular cuboid has three space diagonals, each with length \(d = \sqrt{a^2 + b^2 + c^2}\).

principle_desc_cn: 根据正方体的定义判断立体几何体是否为长方体，注意六个面是否都为矩形，对面平行，相邻面垂直
principle_desc_en: According to the definition of a cube, determine whether a solid geometric figure is a rectangular cuboid by checking whether all six faces are rectangles, opposite faces are parallel, and adjacent faces are perpendicular.

principle_desc_cn: 正方体为一种特殊长方体（\(a=b=c\)），由6个全等正方形围成
principle_desc_en: A cube is a special type of rectangular prism (\(a = b = c\)), formed by 6 congruent squares.

principle_desc_cn: 正方体的棱长\(a\)，空间对角线\(d = a\sqrt{3}\)
principle_desc_en: The edge length of a cube is \(a\), and its space diagonal is \(d = a\sqrt{3}\).

principle_desc_cn: 正方体的内切球半径\(r_{\text{内}}=a/2\)，外接球半径\(R_{\text{外}}=a\sqrt{3}/2\)
principle_desc_en: The inscribed sphere radius of a cube \(r_{\text{in}}=a/2\), and the circumscribed sphere radius \(R_{\text{out}}=a\sqrt{3}/2\).

principle_desc_cn: 根据正方体的定义判断立体几何体是否为正方体，注意六个面是否都为正方形
principle_desc_en: According to the definition of a cube, determine whether a solid geometric figure is a cube. Pay attention to whether all six faces are squares.

principle_desc_cn: 长方形最小展开面积\(S_{\min}=2(ab+bc+ac)\)对应标准展开式
principle_desc_en: The minimum net area of a rectangular cuboid \(S_{\min}=2(ab+bc+ac)\) corresponds to the standard net.

principle_desc_cn: 正方体的展开图共有11种标准型（含1-4-1型6种、2-3-1型3种、3-3型2种），如“十”字型展开为1-4-1型。
principle_desc_en: There are 11 standard types of nets for a cube (including 6 of the 1-4-1 type, 3 of the 2-3-1 type, and 2 of the 3-3 type). For example, the "cross" shaped net is a 1-4-1 type.

principle_en: Formula for Volume of Rectangular Cuboid
principle_desc_cn: 长方体的体积公式为\(V = l \times w \times h\)（\(l\)为长，\(w\)为宽，\(h\)为高）
principle_desc_en: The formula for the volume of a rectangular cuboid is \(V = l \times w \times h\) (\(l\) is the length, \(w\) is the width, \(h\) is the height).

principle_desc_cn: 底面长×宽=15\(\text{m}^2\)，体积=15×2=30\(\text{m}^3\)（与棱长公式等价）
principle_desc_en: Base length × width = 15\(\text{m}^2\), volume = 15 × 2 = 30\(\text{m}^3\) (equivalent to the edge length formula)

principle_en: Practical Applications of Rectangular Cuboid Volume
principle_desc_cn: 长方体体积实际运用包括货轮集装箱容量计算、混凝土浇筑量估算等
principle_desc_en: Practical applications of the volume of a rectangular cuboid include calculating the capacity of cargo ship containers and estimating the amount of concrete required for casting, among others.

principle_en: Formula for Surface Area of Rectangular Cuboid
principle_desc_cn: 长方体表面积公式\(S = 2(lw + lh + wh)\)（如长4cm、宽3cm、高5cm的盒子，\(S=2(12+20+15)=94\text{cm}^2\)）
principle_desc_en: The formula for the surface area of a rectangular cuboid is \(S = 2(lw + lh + wh)\) (for example, for a box with length 4 cm, width 3 cm, and height 5 cm, \(S=2(12+20+15)=94\text{cm}^2\)).

principle_cn: 长方体表面积应用场景
principle_en: Application Scenarios of Rectangular Cuboid Surface Area
principle_desc_cn: 长方体表面积应用场景包括礼品包装纸用量（需加接缝余量）、厂房外墙粉刷面积（扣除门窗后计算）等
principle_desc_en: Application scenarios of the surface area of a rectangular cuboid include the amount of gift wrapping paper needed (with additional allowance for seams), the area of factory exterior walls to be painted (calculated after deducting doors and windows), etc.

principle_cn: 长方体表面积特殊情形
principle_en: Special Cases of Rectangular Cuboid Surface Area
principle_desc_cn: 计算长方体表面积时的特殊情况：无盖长方体（如鱼缸）表面积\(S = lw + 2lh + 2wh\)（少一个顶面）
principle_desc_en: Special case in calculating the surface area of a rectangular cuboid: For an open-top rectangular cuboid (such as a fish tank), the surface area \(S = lw + 2lh + 2wh\) (one top face is omitted).

principle_cn: 长方体表面积工程案例
principle_en: Engineering Cases of Rectangular Cuboid Surface Area
principle_desc_cn: 长方体表面积工程案例包括包括冷库保温层成本核算等
principle_desc_en: Engineering cases of the surface area of a rectangular cuboid include cost calculations for insulation layers in cold storage, etc.

principle_desc_cn: \(V = a^3\)（\(a\)为棱长），拓展公式\(V = S_{\text{底}} \times a\)（底面积\(a^2 \times a =a^3\)）
principle_desc_en: \(V = a^3\) (\(a\) is the edge length), extended formula \(V = S_{\text{base}} \times a\) (base area \(a^2 \times a = a^3\))

principle_desc_cn: 正方体体积实际运用包括仓储立方体货架容量、珠宝展示方盒设计等
principle_desc_en: Practical applications of cube volume include the capacity of cubic storage shelves, the design of cubic jewelry display boxes, and so on.

principle_cn: 正方体长方体体积公式对比分析
principle_en: Comparative Analysis of Cube and Rectangular Cuboid Volume Formulas
principle_desc_cn: 与长方体体积公式的包含关系（当\(l=w=h=a\)时，\(V_{\text{长方体}}=a^3=V_{\text{正方体}}\)）
principle_desc_en: The inclusion relationship between the volume formulas of a rectangular cuboid and a cube (when \(l = w = h = a\), \(V_{\text{cuboid}} = a^3 = V_{\text{cube}}\))

principle_en: Formula for Surface Area of Cube
principle_desc_cn: 正方体的表面积是6个全等正方形面的总面积，数学公式为\(S = 6a^2\)（\(a\)为棱长
principle_desc_en: The surface area of a cube is the total area of its 6 congruent square faces. The mathematical formula is \(S = 6a^2\) (\(a\) is the edge length).

principle_cn: 正方体球体面积公式对比分析
principle_en: Comparative Analysis of Cube and Sphere Surface Area Formulas
principle_desc_cn: 与球体表面积\(4\pi r^2\)差异，同体积下正方体表面积更大
principle_desc_en: Compared with the surface area of a sphere, \(4\pi r^2\), for the same volume, the surface area of a cube is larger.

principle_cn: 正方体表面积应用场景
principle_en: Application Scenarios of Cube Surface Area
principle_desc_cn: 正方体表面积应用场景包括LED立方体灯阵耗材计算（边长为0.5m时总表面积、魔方贴纸裁剪面积等
principle_desc_en: Application scenarios of the surface area of a cube include calculating the material consumption for LED cube light arrays (total surface area when the side length is 0.5m), and the area for cutting stickers for a Rubik's cube, etc.

principle_en: Properties of Faces of Rectangular Cuboid
principle_desc_cn: 长方体的六个面中，相对的两个面是完全相同的矩形，它们的面积相等。长方体的相邻面互相垂直。长方体的前面和左面、前面和底面等都是垂直的。长方体有六个面，每个面都是矩形。
principle_desc_en: Among the six faces of a rectangular cuboid, each pair of opposite faces are congruent rectangles with equal areas. The adjacent faces of a rectangular cuboid are perpendicular to each other. For example, the front face and the left face, as well as the front face and the bottom face, are perpendicular. A rectangular cuboid has six faces, and each face is a rectangle.

principle_en: Properties of Edges of Rectangular Cuboid
principle_desc_cn: 如果长方体的长为 a，宽为 b，高为 c，那么棱长总和为 (a+b+c)×4。长方体的十二条棱中，相对的棱平行且长度相等。
principle_desc_en: If the length, width, and height of a rectangular cuboid are a, b, and c respectively, then the total length of all its edges is (a+b+c)×4. Among the twelve edges of a rectangular cuboid, opposite edges are parallel and have equal lengths.

principle_en: Properties of Diagonals of Rectangular Cuboid
principle_desc_cn: 长方体有三条对称轴，分别是通过相对面中心的三条直线。这三条对称轴分别对应长方体的长、宽、高方向。
principle_desc_en: A rectangular cuboid has three axes of symmetry, which are the three straight lines passing through the centers of its opposite faces. These three axes of symmetry correspond to the length, width, and height directions of the rectangular cuboid, respectively.

principle_desc_cn: 长方体是一个中心对称图形，它的对称中心是体对角线的交点。长方体有三条对称轴，分别是通过相对面中心的三条直线。这三条对称轴分别对应长方体的长、宽、高方向。
principle_desc_en: A rectangular cuboid is a centrally symmetric figure, and its center of symmetry is the intersection point of its space diagonals. A rectangular cuboid has three axes of symmetry, which are the three straight lines passing through the centers of its opposite faces. These three axes of symmetry correspond to the length, width, and height directions of the rectangular cuboid, respectively.

principle_desc_cn: 每个面上的对角线长度为\sqrt{a^2+b^2}（底面）、\sqrt{a^2+c^2}（侧面）、\sqrt{b^2+c^2}（端面）
principle_desc_en: The length of the diagonal on each face is \(\sqrt{a^2+b^2}\) (base face), \(\sqrt{a^2+c^2}\) (side face), \(\sqrt{b^2+c^2}\) (end face).

principle_en: Calculation of Perimeter of Rectangular Cuboid
principle_desc_cn: 由已知长方体的长宽高，计算周长，计算公式为C=4*a+4*b+4*c，其中a、b、c为棱长
principle_desc_en: Given the length, width, and height of a rectangular cuboid, the perimeter can be calculated using the formula C = 4*a + 4*b + 4*c, where a, b, and c are the edge lengths.

principle_en: Finding Edge Length from Known Perimeter
principle_desc_cn: 由已知的长方体周长与某些边的棱长确定另外边的棱长，例如已知长方体的周长以及宽和高的大小，计算长方体长的大小。
principle_desc_en: Determine the length of another edge of a rectangular cuboid from the known perimeter and some edge lengths. For example, given the perimeter of a rectangular cuboid and the values of its width and height, calculate the length of the cuboid.

principle_cn: 生活中的长方体、正方体
principle_en: Rectangular Cuboids and Cubes in Daily Life
principle_desc_cn: 生活中的长方体、正方体为在生活中运用立体几何长方体、正方体的知识解决生活实际问题
principle_desc_en: Rectangular cuboids and cubes in daily life refer to applying the knowledge of solid geometry about rectangular cuboids and cubes to solve practical problems in daily life.

principle_desc_cn: 正方体的六个面都是完全相同的正方形，它们的面积相等。正方体的相邻面互相垂直。例如，正方体的前面和左面、前面和底面等都是垂直的。
principle_desc_en: All six faces of a cube are identical squares, and their areas are equal. The adjacent faces of a cube are perpendicular to each other. For example, the front face and the left face, as well as the front face and the bottom face, are perpendicular.

principle_desc_cn: 如果正方体的棱长为 a，那么棱长总和为 12a。正方体的十二条棱互相平行且长度相等。
principle_desc_en: If the edge length of a cube is a, then the total length of all edges is 12a. The twelve edges of a cube are parallel to each other in pairs and have equal length.

principle_desc_cn: 正方体有四条体对角线，它们是从一个顶点出发，连接到相对顶点的线段。例如，如果正方体的棱长为 a，那么体对角线的长度为\sqrt3a。
principle_desc_en: A cube has four space diagonals, which are line segments connecting one vertex to the opposite vertex. For example, if the edge length of the cube is a, then the length of a space diagonal is \sqrt3a.

principle_desc_cn: 正方体是一个中心对称图形，它的对称中心是体对角线的交点。正方体有四条对称轴，分别是通过相对面中心的四条直线。这四条对称轴分别对应正方体的长、宽、高方向。
principle_desc_en: A cube is a centrally symmetric figure, and its center of symmetry is the intersection point of its space diagonals. A cube has four axes of symmetry, which are the four straight lines passing through the centers of opposite faces. These four axes of symmetry correspond to the length, width, and height directions of the cube.

principle_desc_cn: 由已知的棱长，计算周长。
principle_desc_en: Calculate the perimeter from the given edge length.

principle_en: Finding Edge Length from Known Perimeter
principle_desc_cn: 由已知的正方体周长推出正方体的棱长。
principle_desc_en: Deriving the edge length of a cube from the known perimeter of the cube.
The set of all points in three-dimensional space that satisfy the equation \((x-x_0)^2 + (y-y_0)^2 + (z-z_0)^2 = r^2\) (center \((x_0, y_0, z_0)\), radius \(r\)).

principle_desc_cn: 球的特性为完全对称，任意方向截面为圆
principle_desc_en: The sphere is completely symmetric, and any cross-section in any direction is a circle.

principle_desc_cn: 球的体积公式为\(V = \frac{4}{3}\pi r^3\)，根据积分法推导\(V = \int_{-r}^r \pi (r^2 - z^2) dz = \frac{4}{3}\pi r^3\)
principle_desc_en: The formula for the volume of a sphere is \(V = \frac{4}{3}\pi r^3\). According to the method of integration, it can be derived as \(V = \int_{-r}^r \pi (r^2 - z^2) dz = \frac{4}{3}\pi r^3\).

principle_desc_cn: 体积与半径立方成正比（半径加倍体积增8倍）
principle_desc_en: The volume is directly proportional to the cube of the radius (if the radius is doubled, the volume increases by 8 times).

principle_desc_cn: 球的体积应用场景包括储气罐容量设计、药丸涂层厚度用料等
principle_desc_en: Application scenarios for the volume of a sphere include the design of gas storage tank capacity and the material usage for the coating thickness of pills.

principle_en: Volume of Spherical Segment and Spherical Cap
principle_desc_cn: 球缺与球冠体积（切割部分高度为h）V = \pi h^2 \left( r - \frac{h}{3} \right)
principle_desc_en:
Volume of a spherical segment and spherical cap (height of the cut part is h):  
V = \pi h^2 \left( r - \frac{h}{3} \right)

principle_desc_cn: 计算球的表面积，公式为\( S = 4\pi r^2 \)（如半径3m的球表面积=\(4 \times 3.14 \times 3^2 = 113.04\text{m}^2\)）
principle_desc_en: To calculate the surface area of a sphere, use the formula \( S = 4\pi r^2 \) (for example, the surface area of a sphere with a radius of 3m is \(4 \times 3.14 \times 3^2 = 113.04\text{m}^2\)).

principle_en: Surface Area of Spherical Segment and Spherical Cap
principle_desc_cn: 球缺与球冠表面积（切割部分高度为h）S = 2\pi r h
principle_desc_en: Surface Area of Spherical Segment and Spherical Cap (height of the cut part is h): S = 2\pi r h

principle_desc_cn: 球的中心点，所有到球表面的距离相等，几何中心与质心重合（均匀球体）
principle_desc_en: The center of a sphere is the point from which all distances to the surface of the sphere are equal; the geometric center coincides with the centroid (for a uniform sphere).

principle_desc_cn: 从球心到球表面任一点的距离，符号为\(r\)，决定球体大小，测量时需确保线段通过球心
principle_desc_en: The distance from the center of the sphere to any point on the surface, denoted as \(r\), determines the size of the sphere; when measuring, it is necessary to ensure that the line segment passes through the center of the sphere.

principle_desc_cn: 通过球心的直线两端点之间的距离，公式\(d=2r\)
principle_desc_en: The distance between the two endpoints of a straight line passing through the center of a sphere is given by the formula \(d=2r\).

principle_desc_cn: 生活中的球为在生活中运用立体几何球的知识解决生活实际问题
principle_desc_en: Spheres in daily life refer to applying the knowledge of solid geometry about spheres to solve practical problems in daily life.

principle_desc_cn: 球被一个平面截取后形成的图形是一个圆，截面圆半径\(r' = \sqrt{r^2 - h^2}\)（\(h\)为截面平面到球心的距离）
principle_desc_en: The figure formed when a sphere is cut by a plane is a circle, and the radius of the cross-sectional circle is \(r' = \sqrt{r^2 - h^2}\) (\(h\) is the distance from the plane of the cross-section to the center of the sphere).

principle_desc_cn: 最大截面：当平面过球心时（\(h=0\)），截面圆半径等于球半径，此时截面面积最大为\(\pi r^2\)（如地球赤道截面半径6371km），最小截面：平面切于球表面时（\(h=r\)），截面退化为一个点
principle_desc_en: Maximal section: When the plane passes through the center of the sphere (\(h=0\)), the radius of the cross-sectional circle is equal to the radius of the sphere, and at this time the cross-sectional area is maximized at \(\pi r^2\) (for example, the equatorial section of the Earth has a radius of 6371 km). Minimal section: When the plane is tangent to the surface of the sphere (\(h=r\)), the cross-section degenerates into a single point.

principle_desc_cn: 球的截面的实际应用包括CT扫描中球状器官的横截面成像、篮球切割面分析、天文观测行星投影等
principle_desc_en: The practical applications of sphere sections include cross-sectional imaging of spherical organs in CT scans, analysis of basketball cutting planes, and astronomical observation of planetary projections.

principle_desc_cn: 若球心为O(x_0,y_0,z_0)，截面所在平面方程为ax+by+cz+d = 0，则截面圆的圆心坐标为：C = (x_0,y_0,z_0)- \frac{ax_0+by_0+cz_0+d}{a^2+b^2+c^2}\cdot (a,b,c)
principle_desc_en:
If the center of the sphere is O(x₀, y₀, z₀) and the equation of the plane of the section is ax + by + cz + d = 0, then the coordinates of the center of the sectional circle are:  
C = (x₀, y₀, z₀) - \frac{a x₀ + b y₀ + c z₀ + d}{a^2 + b^2 + c^2} \cdot (a, b, c)

kp_en: Relationship between Line, Plane, and Sphere
principle_desc_cn: 直线穿过球体，与球有两个交点，形成一条弦，弦长公式为\(2\sqrt{r^2 - d^2}\)（\(d\)为直线到球心的距离，\(r\)为球半径
principle_desc_en: A straight line passing through a sphere intersects the sphere at two points, forming a chord. The length of the chord is given by \(2\sqrt{r^2 - d^2}\), where \(d\) is the distance from the line to the center of the sphere, and \(r\) is the radius of the sphere.

kp_en: Relationship between Line, Plane, and Sphere
principle_desc_cn: 直线与球仅有一个公共点，称为切点，满足直线到球心距离等于半径（公式：\(d = r\)
principle_desc_en: A line and a sphere have only one common point, called the point of tangency, which occurs when the distance from the line to the center of the sphere equals the radius (formula: \(d = r\)).

kp_en: Relationship between Line, Plane, and Sphere
principle_en: No Intersection of Line and Sphere
principle_desc_cn: 直线位于球的外部，与球没有交点，判定条件为直线到球心距离\(d > r\)
principle_desc_en: A straight line is located outside the sphere and does not intersect the sphere. The criterion is that the distance from the line to the center of the sphere \(d > r\).

kp_en: Relationship between Line, Plane, and Sphere
principle_desc_cn: 平面切割球体，与球形成一个圆（截面），截面圆半径\(r' = \sqrt{r^2 - h^2}\)（\(h\)为平面到球心距离
principle_desc_en: A plane cuts a sphere, forming a circle (cross-section) with the sphere. The radius of the cross-sectional circle is \(r' = \sqrt{r^2 - h^2}\), where \(h\) is the distance from the plane to the center of the sphere.

kp_en: Relationship between Line, Plane, and Sphere
principle_desc_cn: 平面与球仅有一个公共点，称为切点，满足平面到球心距离等于半径，公式：\(\frac{|Ax_0+By_0+Cz_0+D|}{\sqrt{A^2+B^2+C^2}}=r\)
principle_desc_en: A plane and a sphere have only one common point, called the point of tangency, which satisfies that the distance from the plane to the center of the sphere is equal to the radius. The formula is: \(\frac{|Ax_0+By_0+Cz_0+D|}{\sqrt{A^2+B^2+C^2}}=r\)

kp_en: Relationship between Line, Plane, and Sphere
principle_en: No Intersection of Plane and Sphere
principle_desc_cn: 平面位于球的外部，与球没有交点，判定条件为平面到球心距离\(h > r\)
principle_desc_en: The plane is located outside the sphere and does not intersect the sphere. The criterion is that the distance from the plane to the center of the sphere \(h > r\).

principle_desc_cn: 外接球是一个几何体的外接球，所有顶点都在球面上，球心到每个顶点的距离相等
principle_desc_en: A circumscribed sphere is a sphere that circumscribes a solid figure, with all the vertices lying on the surface of the sphere, and the distances from the center of the sphere to each vertex are equal.

principle_desc_cn: 内切球是一个几何体的内切球，所有面都与球相切，球心到每个面的距离相等
principle_desc_en: An inscribed sphere is a sphere inscribed within a solid, such that all faces of the solid are tangent to the sphere, and the distance from the center of the sphere to each face is equal.

principle_desc_cn: 通过几何体顶点坐标联立方程解球心
principle_desc_en: Solving for the center of the sphere by setting up simultaneous equations using the coordinates of the vertices of the solid.

principle_desc_cn: 利用体积与表面积关系，\(r = \frac{3V}{S}\)，\(V\)为几何体体积，\(S\)为总表面积
principle_desc_en: Using the relationship between volume and surface area, \(r = \frac{3V}{S}\), where \(V\) is the volume of the solid and \(S\) is the total surface area.

principle_cn: 外接球和内切球的关系
principle_en: Relationship between Circumscribed and Inscribed Spheres
principle_desc_cn: 计算外接球和内切球半径的比值，如正四面体的外接球半径是内切球半径的3倍，正方体的外接球半径是内切球半径的\sqrt{3} 倍
principle_desc_en: Calculate the ratio of the radii of the circumscribed sphere and the inscribed sphere. For example, the radius of the circumscribed sphere of a regular tetrahedron is 3 times the radius of its inscribed sphere, and the radius of the circumscribed sphere of a cube is \sqrt{3} times the radius of its inscribed sphere.

principle_desc_cn: 由已知的基本立体图形组合成新的物体，计算该新物体的体积，通常情况下可以分别计算作为组合元素的基础立体图形的体积，最终进行相加，得到不规则图形的体积。
principle_desc_en: When a new object is formed by combining known basic solid figures, to calculate the volume of this new object, it is usually possible to separately calculate the volumes of the basic solid figures that serve as the components of the combination, and finally add them together to obtain the volume of the irregular solid.

principle_desc_cn: 在已知的基本立体图形中去除掉一部分体积，计算该新物体的体积，通常情况下可以分别计算原始立体图形和被去除的体积大小，最终进行相减，得到不规则图形的体积。
principle_desc_en: When a portion of the volume is removed from a known basic solid figure, to calculate the volume of the new object, the volumes of the original solid figure and the removed part can usually be calculated separately, and then subtracted to obtain the volume of the irregular figure.

l4_en: Positional Relationships of Points, Lines, and Planes
principle_desc_cn: 平面是无限延伸的二维空间，没有厚度，可以看作由无数条直线组成的连续集合，三维空间中一般方程\(Ax + By + Cz + D = 0\)
principle_desc_en: A plane is an infinitely extended two-dimensional space without thickness, which can be regarded as a continuous set composed of infinitely many straight lines. In three-dimensional space, its general equation is \(Ax + By + Cz + D = 0\).

l4_en: Positional Relationships of Points, Lines, and Planes
principle_desc_cn: \(\vec{n} \cdot (\vec{r} - \vec{r_0}) = 0\)（\(\vec{n}\)为法向量，\(\vec{r_0}\)为平面上已知点）
principle_desc_en: \(\vec{n} \cdot (\vec{r} - \vec{r_0}) = 0\) (\(\vec{n}\) is the normal vector, \(\vec{r_0}\) is a known point on the plane)

l4_en: Positional Relationships of Points, Lines, and Planes
principle_desc_en: Three non-collinear points determine a plane. For example, the three points \((1,0,0),(0,1,0),(0,0,1)\) determine the plane \(x+y+z=1\).

l4_en: Positional Relationships of Points, Lines, and Planes
principle_desc_cn: 特殊平面包括坐标平面（如\(z=0\)为XY平面）、投影平面（机械制图中侧视图对应\(y=0\)平面）等
principle_desc_en: Special planes include coordinate planes (for example, \(z=0\) is the XY-plane), projection planes (in mechanical drawing, the plane corresponding to the side view is \(y=0\)), and so on.

l4_en: Positional Relationships of Points, Lines, and Planes
principle_desc_cn: 建筑地基平整度检测（平面方程拟合）、卫星轨道平面计算（地球赤道平面方程\(z=0\)）
principle_desc_en: Detection of building foundation flatness (plane equation fitting), calculation of satellite orbital planes (Earth's equatorial plane equation \(z=0\))

l4_en: Positional Relationships of Points, Lines, and Planes
principle_cn: 异面直线的定义及其判定方法
principle_en: Definition and Determination of Skew Lines
principle_desc_cn: 在三维空间中，既不相交也不平行的两条直线称为异面直线，它们不在同一平面上，且不共线，数学表示为两直线参数方程\(\begin{cases} L_1: \vec{r} = \vec{a} + t\vec{u} \\ L_2: \vec{r} = \vec{b} + s\vec{v} \end{cases}\)满足\(\vec{u} \nparallel \vec{v}\)且方程组无解。可计算混合积判定\(\left| (\vec{b}-\vec{a}) \cdot (\vec{u} \times \vec{v}) \right| \neq 0\)
principle_desc_en: In three-dimensional space, two lines that are neither intersecting nor parallel are called skew lines. They do not lie in the same plane and are not collinear. Mathematically, the parametric equations of the two lines \(\begin{cases} L_1: \vec{r} = \vec{a} + t\vec{u} \\ L_2: \vec{r} = \vec{b} + s\vec{v} \end{cases}\) satisfy \(\vec{u} \nparallel \vec{v}\) and the system of equations has no solution. The mixed product criterion can be used: \(\left| (\vec{b}-\vec{a}) \cdot (\vec{u} \times \vec{v}) \right| \neq 0\).

l4_en: Positional Relationships of Points, Lines, and Planes
principle_desc_cn: \(d = \frac{|\vec{AB} \cdot (\vec{u} \times \vec{v})|}{|\vec{u} \times \vec{v}|}\)
principle_desc_en:
Category: Geometry > Solid Geometry > Spatial Relationships > Positional Relationships of Points, Lines, and Planes > Definition of Skew Lines > Formula for Shortest Distance  
Principle description: \(d = \frac{|\vec{AB} \cdot (\vec{u} \times \vec{v})|}{|\vec{u} \times \vec{v}|}\)

l4_en: Positional Relationships of Points, Lines, and Planes
principle_desc_cn: 异面直线实际运用包括立交桥交叉道路设计、机械臂轨迹避让等
principle_desc_en: Practical applications of skew lines include the design of intersecting roads in overpasses and the trajectory avoidance of robotic arms.

l4_en: Positional Relationships of Points, Lines, and Planes
principle_desc_cn: 是立体几何中描述平面内直线与空间斜线垂直关系的定理。其核心内容为：平面内的一条直线若与斜线在该平面上的射影垂直，则它也与斜线本身垂直。
principle_desc_en: It is a theorem in solid geometry that describes the perpendicular relationship between a straight line in a plane and a skew line in space. Its core content is: If a straight line in a plane is perpendicular to the projection of a skew line onto that plane, then it is also perpendicular to the skew line itself.

l4_en: Positional Relationships of Points, Lines, and Planes
principle_desc_cn: 如果一个角的两边和另一个角的两边分别平行，那么这两个角相等或互补，数学表述为若\(\vec{u}_1 \parallel \vec{u}_2\)且\(\vec{v}_1 \parallel \vec{v}_2\)，则\(\theta_1 = \theta_2\)或\(\theta_1 + \theta_2 = 180^\circ\)
principle_desc_en: If the two sides of one angle are respectively parallel to the two sides of another angle, then the two angles are either equal or supplementary. Mathematically, if \(\vec{u}_1 \parallel \vec{u}_2\) and \(\vec{v}_1 \parallel \vec{v}_2\), then \(\theta_1 = \theta_2\) or \(\theta_1 + \theta_2 = 180^\circ\).

l4_en: Positional Relationships of Points, Lines, and Planes
principle_desc_cn: 根据等角定理判断夹角是否相等
principle_desc_en: Determine whether the included angles are equal according to the Equal Angle Theorem.

l4_en: Positional Relationships of Points, Lines, and Planes
principle_en: Distinction between Equal Angles and Supplementary Angles
principle_desc_cn: 考虑三维空间反向平行情况，如两个角的边向量一对同向，另一对反向如\(\vec{u}_2 = -k\vec{u}_1\)时，两个角度互补
principle_desc_en: Consider the case of reverse parallelism in three-dimensional space: if, for two angles, one pair of edge vectors is in the same direction and the other pair is in the opposite direction, such as \(\vec{u}_2 = -k\vec{u}_1\), then the two angles are supplementary.

l4_en: Positional Relationships of Points, Lines, and Planes
principle_desc_cn: 两条异面直线的方向向量的点积为零，即\(\vec{u} \cdot \vec{v} = a_1a_2 + b_1b_2 + c_1c_2 = 0\)
principle_desc_en: The dot product of the direction vectors of two skew lines is zero, that is, \(\vec{u} \cdot \vec{v} = a_1a_2 + b_1b_2 + c_1c_2 = 0\).

l4_en: Positional Relationships of Points, Lines, and Planes
principle_desc_cn: 方向向量正交但直线不共面
principle_desc_en: The direction vectors are orthogonal but the lines are not coplanar.

l4_en: Positional Relationships of Points, Lines, and Planes
principle_desc_cn: 混合积判定法，两条异面直线 \( l_1 : \vec{r} = \vec{a} + t\vec{u} \) 和 \( l_2 : \vec{r} = \vec{b} + s\vec{v} \) 垂直且异面的判定条件为：\begin{cases}
principle_desc_en: Mixed product determination method: The condition for two skew lines \( l_1 : \vec{r} = \vec{a} + t\vec{u} \) and \( l_2 : \vec{r} = \vec{b} + s\vec{v} \) to be perpendicular and skew is: \begin{cases}

l4_en: Positional Relationships of Points, Lines, and Planes
principle_desc_cn: 直线与平面没有交点，且直线的方向向量与平面的法向量垂直，公式：\(\vec{u} \cdot \vec{n} = 0\)
principle_desc_en: A line and a plane have no intersection point, and the direction vector of the line is perpendicular to the normal vector of the plane. Formula: \(\vec{u} \cdot \vec{n} = 0\)

l4_en: Positional Relationships of Points, Lines, and Planes
principle_desc_cn: 直线与平面有且只有一个公共点
principle_desc_en: A line and a plane have one and only one common point.

l4_en: Positional Relationships of Points, Lines, and Planes
principle_desc_cn: 直线的方向向量与平面的法向量平行，公式：\(\vec{u} \parallel \vec{n}\)
principle_desc_en: The direction vector of the line is parallel to the normal vector of the plane, formula: \(\vec{u} \parallel \vec{n}\)

l4_en: Positional Relationships of Points, Lines, and Planes
principle_cn: 直线与平面的对称问题
principle_en: Symmetry Problems of Line and Plane
principle_desc_cn: 求直线关于平面的对称直线，可以先求直线上两点关于平面的对称点，再根据对称点确定新的直线方程
principle_desc_en: To find the line symmetric to a given line with respect to a plane, first find the symmetric points of two points on the line with respect to the plane, and then determine the equation of the new line based on the symmetric points.

l4_en: Positional Relationships of Points, Lines, and Planes
principle_desc_cn: 两个平面没有交点，且它们的法向量平行，公式：\(\vec{n}_1 = k\vec{n}_2\)
principle_desc_en: Two planes have no intersection points, and their normal vectors are parallel. Formula: \(\vec{n}_1 = k\vec{n}_2\)

l4_en: Positional Relationships of Points, Lines, and Planes
principle_desc_cn: 两个平面有一条公共直线，且它们的法向量不平行（公式：\(\vec{n}_1 \nparallel \vec{n}_2\)）
principle_desc_en: Two planes have a common line, and their normal vectors are not parallel (formula: \(\vec{n}_1 \nparallel \vec{n}_2\)).

l4_en: Positional Relationships of Points, Lines, and Planes
principle_desc_cn: 两个平面的法向量点积为零，公式：\(\vec{n}_1 \cdot \vec{n}_2 = 0\)
principle_desc_en: The dot product of the normal vectors of two planes is zero, formula: \(\vec{n}_1 \cdot \vec{n}_2 = 0\)

l4_en: Positional Relationships of Points, Lines, and Planes
principle_desc_cn: 点的坐标满足平面的方程即在平面上，公式：\(Ax_0 + By_0 + Cz_0 + D = 0\)
principle_desc_en: The coordinates of a point satisfy the equation of the plane if and only if the point lies on the plane. Formula: \(Ax_0 + By_0 + Cz_0 + D = 0\)

l4_en: Positional Relationships of Points, Lines, and Planes
principle_desc_cn: 点的坐标不满足平面的方程即在平面外
principle_desc_en: The coordinates of the point do not satisfy the equation of the plane, i.e., the point is outside the plane.

l4_en: Positional Relationships of Points, Lines, and Planes
principle_desc_cn: 一个平面将空间分成两部分，数学描述：平面方程\(Ax+By+Cz+D=0\)将空间划分为\(Ax+By+Cz+D>0\)和\(Ax+By+Cz+D<0\)两个半空间
principle_desc_en: A plane divides space into two parts. Mathematical description: The plane equation \(Ax+By+Cz+D=0\) divides space into two half-spaces, \(Ax+By+Cz+D>0\) and \(Ax+By+Cz+D<0\).

l4_en: Positional Relationships of Points, Lines, and Planes
principle_desc_cn: 两个相交的平面将空间分成四部分，条件：法向量不平行，即\(\vec{n}_1 \nparallel \vec{n}_2\)，交线方程为联立两平面方程
principle_desc_en: Two intersecting planes divide space into four regions. Condition: the normal vectors are not parallel, i.e., \(\vec{n}_1 \nparallel \vec{n}_2\). The equation of the intersection line is obtained by solving the two plane equations simultaneously.

l4_en: Positional Relationships of Points, Lines, and Planes
principle_cn: 三个互相垂直的平面分空间
principle_en: Three Mutually Perpendicular Planes Dividing Space
principle_desc_cn: 三个互相垂直的平面将空间分成八部分，类比坐标平面\(x=0,y=0,z=0\)，每部分由三个不等式组合确定
principle_desc_en: Three mutually perpendicular planes divide space into eight regions, analogous to the coordinate planes \(x=0, y=0, z=0\), with each region determined by a combination of three inequalities.

l4_en: Positional Relationships of Points, Lines, and Planes
principle_cn: 平面分空间的最大数量
principle_en: Maximum Number of Regions Divided by Planes
principle_desc_cn: n 个平面最多将空间分割成\frac{n^{3}+5 n+6}{6}个部分
principle_desc_en: n planes can divide space into at most \frac{n^{3}+5 n+6}{6} regions.

l4_en: Positional Relationships of Points, Lines, and Planes
principle_desc_cn: 两条直线位于同一平面内，条件：混合积\((\vec{AB} \cdot (\vec{u} \times \vec{v}))=0\)，其中\(\vec{AB}\)为两线间向量，\(\vec{u},\vec{v}\)为方向向量
principle_desc_en: Two lines lie in the same plane if and only if the condition \((\vec{AB} \cdot (\vec{u} \times \vec{v})) = 0\) is satisfied, where \(\vec{AB}\) is the vector between the two lines, and \(\vec{u}, \vec{v}\) are their direction vectors.

l4_en: Positional Relationships of Points, Lines, and Planes
principle_desc_cn: 三条直线位于同一平面内，条件：任意两线间向量与方向向量混合积为零
principle_desc_en: Three lines lie in the same plane if and only if the mixed product of the vector between any two lines and their direction vectors is zero.

l4_en: Positional Relationships of Points, Lines, and Planes
principle_desc_cn: 点和直线位于同一平面内，条件：点坐标代入直线参数方程确定的平面方程\(Ax+By+Cz+D=0\)成立
principle_desc_en: A point and a straight line lie in the same plane if and only if the coordinates of the point satisfy the plane equation \(Ax+By+Cz+D=0\) determined by substituting the point's coordinates into the parametric equation of the line.

l4_en: Positional Relationships of Points, Lines, and Planes
principle_cn: 点线共面求解平面方程
principle_en: Finding Plane Equation from Coplanar Point and Line
principle_desc_cn: 已知直线l和点P \notin l，求过l和P的平面方程。
principle_desc_en: Given a straight line l and a point P such that P \notin l, find the equation of the plane passing through l and P.

l4_en: Positional Relationships of Points, Lines, and Planes
principle_cn: 共点的条件及判定方法
principle_desc_cn: 直线方程组有唯一解，即直线不平行且不重合，判定方法为解联立方程组，若存在唯一解，则直线共点
principle_desc_en: The system of linear equations has a unique solution, that is, the lines are neither parallel nor coincident. The method of determination is to solve the system of equations; if there is a unique solution, then the lines are concurrent.

l4_en: Positional Relationships of Points, Lines, and Planes
principle_en: Application of Pencil of Planes Equation
principle_desc_cn: 若两直线交于P，过P的直线可表为l_1 + \lambda l_2 = 0，代入第三条线求\lambda
principle_desc_en: If two lines intersect at P, a line passing through P can be represented as l_1 + \lambda l_2 = 0. Substitute into the equation of the third line to solve for \lambda.

l4_en: Positional Relationships of Points, Lines, and Planes
principle_desc_cn: 和两条异面直线都垂直相交的直线叫做两条异面直线的公垂线，公垂线段的长度计算公式为\(d = \frac{|\vec{AB} \cdot (\vec{u} \times \vec{v})|}{|\vec{u} \times \vec{v}|}\)，\(\vec{AB}\)为两线上任意两点向量，\(\vec{u},\vec{v}\)为两直线方向向量
principle_desc_en: A line that is perpendicular to and intersects both skew lines is called the common perpendicular of the two skew lines. The length of the segment of the common perpendicular is calculated by the formula \(d = \frac{|\vec{AB} \cdot (\vec{u} \times \vec{v})|}{|\vec{u} \times \vec{v}|}\), where \(\vec{AB}\) is the vector between any two points on the two lines, and \(\vec{u}, \vec{v}\) are the direction vectors of the two lines.

l4_en: Positional Relationships of Points, Lines, and Planes
principle_desc_cn: 过空间任意一点引两条直线分别平行于两条异面直线，它们所成的锐角（或直角）就是异面直线所成的角，角的范围是θ∈（0°,90°]，计算公式为\(\cos\theta = \frac{|\vec{u} \cdot \vec{v}|}{|\vec{u}||\vec{v}|}\)（\(\vec{u},\vec{v}\)为两异面直线的方向向量
principle_desc_en: Through any point in space, draw two lines parallel to the two skew lines respectively. The acute angle (or right angle) formed by these two lines is the angle between the skew lines. The range of the angle is θ∈(0°, 90°]. The calculation formula is \(\cos\theta = \frac{|\vec{u} \cdot \vec{v}|}{|\vec{u}||\vec{v}|}\), where \(\vec{u}, \vec{v}\) are the direction vectors of the two skew lines.

l4_en: Positional Relationships of Points, Lines, and Planes
principle_en: Range of Angles between Skew Lines
principle_desc_cn: \theta \in \left [0,\frac{\pi }{2} \right ] ，与向量夹角范围不同
principle_desc_en: θ ∈ [0, π/2], which is different from the range of angles between vectors.

l4_cn: 空间平行和垂直的判定和性质
l4_en: Criteria and Properties of Parallelism and Perpendicularity in Space
kp_en: Definition of Line Parallel to Plane
principle_en: Theorem for Line Parallel to Plane
principle_desc_cn: 若直线与平面内的两条相交直线分别平行，则该直线与平面平行，向量条件：直线的方向向量\(\vec{u}\)与平面法向量\(\vec{n}\)满足\(\vec{u} \cdot \vec{n} = 0\)且直线不落在平面内
principle_desc_en: If a line is parallel to two intersecting lines lying in a plane, then the line is parallel to the plane. Vector condition: the direction vector \(\vec{u}\) of the line and the normal vector \(\vec{n}\) of the plane satisfy \(\vec{u} \cdot \vec{n} = 0\), and the line does not lie in the plane.

l4_cn: 空间平行和垂直的判定和性质
l4_en: Criteria and Properties of Parallelism and Perpendicularity in Space
principle_desc_cn: 若一个平面内的两条相交直线分别平行于另一个平面，则这两个平面平行，向量条件：两平面法向量平行，即\(\vec{n}_1 = k\vec{n}_2\)
principle_desc_en: If two intersecting lines in one plane are respectively parallel to another plane, then the two planes are parallel. Vector condition: the normal vectors of the two planes are parallel, that is, \(\vec{n}_1 = k\vec{n}_2\).

l4_cn: 空间平行和垂直的判定和性质
l4_en: Criteria and Properties of Parallelism and Perpendicularity in Space
kp_en: Definition of Line Perpendicular to Plane
principle_en: Theorem for Line Perpendicular to Plane
principle_desc_cn: 如果一条直线与平面内任意一条直线都垂直，那么这条直线与这个平面垂直，向量条件：直线方向向量\(\vec{u}\)与平面法向量\(\vec{n}\)平行，即\(\vec{u} = k\vec{n}\
principle_desc_en: If a line is perpendicular to every line in a plane, then the line is perpendicular to the plane. Vector condition: the direction vector of the line \(\vec{u}\) is parallel to the normal vector of the plane \(\vec{n}\), that is, \(\vec{u} = k\vec{n}\)

l4_cn: 空间平行和垂直的判定和性质
l4_en: Criteria and Properties of Parallelism and Perpendicularity in Space
principle_desc_cn: 一个平面过另一平面的垂线，则这两个平面相互垂直，向量条件：两平面法向量正交，即\(\vec{n}_1 \cdot \vec{n}_2 = 0\
principle_desc_en: If a plane passes through the perpendicular of another plane, then these two planes are perpendicular to each other. Vector condition: the normal vectors of the two planes are orthogonal, that is, \(\vec{n}_1 \cdot \vec{n}_2 = 0\).

l4_cn: 空间平行和垂直的判定和性质
l4_en: Criteria and Properties of Parallelism and Perpendicularity in Space
kp_en: Properties of Line Parallel to Plane
principle_desc_cn: 如果一条直线与一个平面平行，那么过这条直线的任一平面与此平面的交线与该直线平行，公式：设直线\(L\)方向向量\(\vec{u}\)，原平面法向量\(\vec{n}\)，则交线方向向量\(\vec{v} = \vec{u} \times \vec{n}\)必与\(\vec{u}\)共线
principle_desc_en: If a straight line is parallel to a plane, then the intersection line of any plane passing through this straight line with the given plane is parallel to the straight line. Formula: Let the direction vector of line \(L\) be \(\vec{u}\), and the normal vector of the original plane be \(\vec{n}\). Then the direction vector of the intersection line, \(\vec{v} = \vec{u} \times \vec{n}\), must be collinear with \(\vec{u}\).

l4_cn: 空间平行和垂直的判定和性质
l4_en: Criteria and Properties of Parallelism and Perpendicularity in Space
kp_en: Properties of Line Parallel to Plane
principle_desc_cn: 直线 L 上任意点到平面 \alpha 的距离相等，即平行直线到平面的距离处处相同
principle_desc_en: The distance from any point on line L to plane \alpha is equal, that is, the distance from a parallel line to a plane is the same everywhere.

l4_cn: 空间平行和垂直的判定和性质
l4_en: Criteria and Properties of Parallelism and Perpendicularity in Space
principle_en: Line in Plane Parallel to Plane
principle_desc_cn: 两个平面平行，在一个平面内的任意一条直线平行于另外一个平面，公式：平面\(\alpha \parallel \beta\)，则\(\forall \vec{u} \in \alpha\)满足\(\vec{u} \cdot \vec{n}_\beta = 0\)
principle_desc_en: If two planes are parallel, any line in one plane is parallel to the other plane. Formula: If plane \(\alpha \parallel \beta\), then for any \(\vec{u} \in \alpha\), \(\vec{u} \cdot \vec{n}_\beta = 0\).

l4_cn: 空间平行和垂直的判定和性质
l4_en: Criteria and Properties of Parallelism and Perpendicularity in Space
principle_en: Parallelism of Intersection Lines of Planes
principle_desc_cn: 两个平行平面，分别和第三个平面相交，交线平行，公式：平面\(\alpha \parallel \beta\)与\(\gamma\)相交，交线方向向量\(\vec{v}_1 \parallel \vec{v}_2\)
principle_desc_en: Two parallel planes, each intersecting a third plane, have parallel intersection lines. Formula: Planes \(\alpha \parallel \beta\) intersect with \(\gamma\), and the direction vectors of the intersection lines \(\vec{v}_1 \parallel \vec{v}_2\).

l4_cn: 空间平行和垂直的判定和性质
l4_en: Criteria and Properties of Parallelism and Perpendicularity in Space
principle_desc_cn: 两个平面平行，和一个平面垂直的直线必垂直于另外一个平面，公式：\(\alpha \parallel \beta\)且直线\(L \perp \alpha\)，则\(L\)方向向量\(\vec{u} \parallel \vec{n}_\beta\)
principle_desc_en: If two planes are parallel, then any line perpendicular to one of the planes is also perpendicular to the other plane. Formula: \(\alpha \parallel \beta\) and line \(L \perp \alpha\), then the direction vector of \(L\), \(\vec{u} \parallel \vec{n}_\beta\).

l4_cn: 空间平行和垂直的判定和性质
l4_en: Criteria and Properties of Parallelism and Perpendicularity in Space
kp_en: Properties of Line Perpendicular to Plane
principle_desc_cn: 垂直于同一平面的两条直线平行，公式：若\(L_1 \perp \alpha\)且\(L_2 \perp \alpha\)，则\(\vec{u}_1 \parallel \vec{u}_2\)
principle_desc_en: Two lines perpendicular to the same plane are parallel. Formula: If \(L_1 \perp \alpha\) and \(L_2 \perp \alpha\), then \(\vec{u}_1 \parallel \vec{u}_2\).

l4_cn: 空间平行和垂直的判定和性质
l4_en: Criteria and Properties of Parallelism and Perpendicularity in Space
kp_en: Properties of Line Perpendicular to Plane
principle_desc_cn: 如果一条直线垂直于一个平面，那么这条直线垂直于平面内的所有直线，公式：\(L \perp \alpha \Rightarrow \vec{u}_L \cdot \vec{v} = 0\)（\(\forall \vec{v} \in \alpha\)）
principle_desc_en: If a line is perpendicular to a plane, then this line is perpendicular to all lines in the plane. Formula: \(L \perp \alpha \Rightarrow \vec{u}_L \cdot \vec{v} = 0\) (\(\forall \vec{v} \in \alpha\))

l4_cn: 空间平行和垂直的判定和性质
l4_en: Criteria and Properties of Parallelism and Perpendicularity in Space
principle_desc_cn: 如果两个平面相互垂直，那么在一个平面内垂直于它们交线的直线垂直于另一个平面，公式：设平面\(\alpha \perp \beta\)，交线方向向量\(\vec{v}\)，则\(\alpha\)内向量\(\vec{u} \perp \vec{v}\)满足\(\vec{u} \parallel \vec{n}_\beta\)
principle_desc_en: If two planes are perpendicular to each other, then a line in one plane that is perpendicular to their intersection line is perpendicular to the other plane. Formula: Let planes \(\alpha \perp \beta\), with intersection line direction vector \(\vec{v}\), then a vector \(\vec{u}\) in \(\alpha\) such that \(\vec{u} \perp \vec{v}\) satisfies \(\vec{u} \parallel \vec{n}_\beta\).

l4_cn: 空间平行和垂直的判定和性质
l4_en: Criteria and Properties of Parallelism and Perpendicularity in Space
principle_en: Intersection Line of Planes Perpendicular to Plane
principle_desc_cn: 如果两个相交平面都垂直于第三个平面，那么它们的交线垂直于第三个平面，公式：平面\(\alpha \perp \gamma\)且\(\beta \perp \gamma\)，则交线方向向量\(\vec{v} = \vec{n}_\alpha \times \vec{n}_\beta \parallel \vec{n}_\gamma\)
principle_desc_en: If two intersecting planes are both perpendicular to a third plane, then their intersection line is perpendicular to the third plane. Formula: If plane \(\alpha \perp \gamma\) and \(\beta \perp \gamma\), then the direction vector of the intersection line \(\vec{v} = \vec{n}_\alpha \times \vec{n}_\beta \parallel \vec{n}_\gamma\).

l4_cn: 空间平行和垂直的判定和性质
l4_en: Criteria and Properties of Parallelism and Perpendicularity in Space
principle_desc_cn: 过平面外一点做平面的垂线，点到垂足的距离就是点到平面的距离，公式：\(d = \frac{|Ax_0 + By_0 + Cz_0 + D|}{\sqrt{A^2 + B^2 + C^2}}\)
principle_desc_en: Draw a perpendicular from a point outside the plane to the plane; the distance from the point to the foot of the perpendicular is the distance from the point to the plane. The formula is: \(d = \frac{|Ax_0 + By_0 + Cz_0 + D|}{\sqrt{A^2 + B^2 + C^2}}\)

l4_cn: 空间平行和垂直的判定和性质
l4_en: Criteria and Properties of Parallelism and Perpendicularity in Space
principle_desc_cn: 线面平行时，线上任意一点到平面距离就是线面距离，公式：取直线上一点\(P(x_1,y_1,z_1)\)，计算\(d = \frac{|Ax_1 + By_1 + Cz_1 + D|}{\sqrt{A^2 + B^2 + C^2}}\)
principle_desc_en: When a line is parallel to a plane, the distance from any point on the line to the plane is the distance from the line to the plane. The formula is: take a point \(P(x_1, y_1, z_1)\) on the line, and calculate \(d = \frac{|Ax_1 + By_1 + Cz_1 + D|}{\sqrt{A^2 + B^2 + C^2}}\).

l4_cn: 空间平行和垂直的判定和性质
l4_en: Criteria and Properties of Parallelism and Perpendicularity in Space
principle_desc_cn: 面面平行时，面上任意一点到另一面距离即为面面距离，公式：两平行平面\(Ax+By+Cz+D_1=0\)与\(Ax+By+Cz+D_2=0\)间距离\(d = \frac{|D_1 - D_2|}{\sqrt{A^2+B^2+C^2}}\)
principle_desc_en: When two planes are parallel, the distance from any point on one plane to the other plane is the distance between the two planes. The formula: For two parallel planes \(Ax+By+Cz+D_1=0\) and \(Ax+By+Cz+D_2=0\), the distance between the planes is \(d = \frac{|D_1 - D_2|}{\sqrt{A^2+B^2+C^2}}\).

l4_cn: 空间平行和垂直的判定和性质
l4_en: Criteria and Properties of Parallelism and Perpendicularity in Space
principle_en: Definition of Angle between Line and Plane
principle_desc_cn: 直线与平面之间的夹角θ∈[0°,90°]，满足\(\sin\theta = \frac{|\vec{u} \cdot \vec{n}|}{|\vec{u}||\vec{n}|}\)（\(\vec{u}\)为直线方向向量，\(\vec{n}\)为平面法向量
principle_desc_en: The angle θ between a line and a plane, where θ∈[0°, 90°], satisfies \(\sin\theta = \frac{|\vec{u} \cdot \vec{n}|}{|\vec{u}||\vec{n}|}\) (\(\vec{u}\) is the direction vector of the line, and \(\vec{n}\) is the normal vector of the plane).

l4_cn: 空间平行和垂直的判定和性质
l4_en: Criteria and Properties of Parallelism and Perpendicularity in Space
principle_desc_cn: 线面角是直线与平面内所有直线所成角中的最小值
principle_desc_en: The angle between a line and a plane is the minimum value among the angles formed between the line and all lines in the plane.

l4_cn: 空间平行和垂直的判定和性质
l4_en: Criteria and Properties of Parallelism and Perpendicularity in Space
principle_desc_cn: 两平面间夹角φ∈[0°,180°]，满足\(\cos\phi = \frac{|\vec{n}_1 \cdot \vec{n}_2|}{|\vec{n}_1||\vec{n}_2|}\)（\(\vec{n}_1,\vec{n}_2\)为两平面法向量
principle_desc_en: The angle φ between two planes, φ∈[0°,180°], satisfies \(\cos\phi = \frac{|\vec{n}_1 \cdot \vec{n}_2|}{|\vec{n}_1||\vec{n}_2|}\) (\(\vec{n}_1, \vec{n}_2\) are the normal vectors of the two planes).

principle_desc_cn: 从物体正面垂直投影得到的视图，显示物体的高度和宽度，数学描述：投影面为\(y-z\)平面，坐标\(x=0\)，投影变换矩阵\(\begin{bmatrix}0&0&0\\0&1&0\\0&0&1\end{bmatrix}\)
principle_desc_en: The view obtained by orthogonal projection from the front of the object, showing the height and width of the object. Mathematical description: the projection plane is the \(y\)-\(z\) plane, with coordinates \(x=0\), and the projection transformation matrix is \(\begin{bmatrix}0&0&0\\0&1&0\\0&0&1\end{bmatrix}\).

principle_desc_cn: 从物体顶部垂直向下投影得到的视图，显示物体的长度和宽度，投影面为\(x-y\)平面，坐标\(z=0\)，隐藏高度信息
principle_desc_en: The view obtained by projecting vertically downward from the top of the object, showing the object's length and width, with the projection plane being the \(x-y\) plane, coordinates \(z=0\), and height information hidden.

principle_desc_cn: 从物体侧面垂直投影得到的视图，显示物体的高度和长度，投影面为\(x-z\)平面，坐标\(y=0\)
principle_desc_en: The view obtained by projecting perpendicularly from the side of the object, showing the height and length of the object; the projection plane is the \(x-z\) plane, with the coordinate \(y=0\).

principle_desc_cn: 遵循正投影法，确保每个视图准确反映物体在对应投影面上的结构，数学条件：投影线垂直于投影面，隐藏线用虚线表示
principle_desc_en: Follow the orthographic projection method to ensure that each view accurately reflects the structure of the object on the corresponding projection plane. Mathematical condition: projection lines are perpendicular to the projection plane, and hidden lines are represented by dashed lines.

principle_desc_cn: 确定几何体的长、宽、高，可以通过正视图、侧视图和俯视图的观测得到
principle_desc_en: The length, width, and height of a solid can be determined by observing its front view, side view, and top view.

principle_cn: 由三视图还原计算体积
principle_desc_cn: 根据长、宽、高画出基础几何体，如长方体或柱体，公式：长方体体积\(V=lwh\)，圆柱体积\(V=\pi r^2 h\)（半径\(r\)由俯视图圆直径确定）
principle_desc_en: Draw the basic geometric body, such as a cuboid or a cylinder, according to the length, width, and height. Formulas: cuboid volume \(V = lwh\), cylinder volume \(V = \pi r^2 h\) (the radius \(r\) is determined by the diameter of the circle in the top view).

principle_en: Truncation and Supplementation in Three Views
principle_desc_cn: 依据三视图的细节，对几何体进行适当的截取或补充，使其符合给定条件，如俯视图含内切圆则截取圆锥，体积修正为\(V_{\text{原}} - V_{\text{截}}\)
principle_desc_en: According to the details in the three-view drawing, appropriately truncate or supplement the solid so that it meets the given conditions. For example, if the top view contains an inscribed circle, truncate the cone, and the volume is corrected as \(V_{\text{original}} - V_{\text{truncated}}\).

principle_desc_cn: 观察三视图，确定几何体的基本形状，如长方体、圆柱体或其他复合体
principle_desc_en: Observe the three-view drawing to determine the basic shape of the solid, such as a rectangular prism, cylinder, or other composite body.

principle_cn: 挖空拼接的三视图计算体积
principle_en: Calculating Volume for Hollowed and Assembled Solids from Three Views
principle_desc_cn: 若几何体存在挖空或拼接部分，需分别计算体积，再进行加减运算
principle_desc_en: If a solid has hollowed or assembled parts, calculate the volume of each part separately, and then perform addition or subtraction accordingly.

kp_cn: 根据三视图计算表面积
kp_en: Calculating Surface Area from Three-View Drawing
principle_cn: 根据三视图计算表面积
principle_en: Calculating Surface Area from Three Views
principle_desc_cn: 通过三视图识别几何体的各个面，确定其形状和尺寸，公式：长方体可见面积=正视图面积\(h \times w\)+俯视图面积\(l \times w\)+侧视图面积\(h \times l\)，总表面积=\(2(lw + wh + hl)\)
principle_desc_en: Identify each face of the solid from the three-view drawing, determine its shape and dimensions. Formula: The visible area of a rectangular prism = front view area \(h \times w\) + top view area \(l \times w\) + side view area \(h \times l\); total surface area = \(2(lw + wh + hl)\).

kp_cn: 根据三视图计算表面积
kp_en: Calculating Surface Area from Three-View Drawing
principle_cn: 挖空拼接的三视图计算表面积
principle_en: Calculating Surface Area for Hollowed and Assembled Solids from Three Views
principle_desc_cn: 若几何体存在挖空或额外拼接部分，需分别计算其表面积，并进行加减处理
principle_desc_en: If the solid has hollowed or additionally assembled parts, their surface areas need to be calculated separately and then added or subtracted accordingly.

principle_desc_cn: 一种投影方法，其中投影线从一点（投影中心）发出，经过物体后投射到投影面上，形成的视图称为中心投影，数学描述：投影变换矩阵含透视分量，如\(\begin{bmatrix}x'\\y'\\z'\end{bmatrix} = \frac{d}{z}\begin{bmatrix}x\\y\\z\end{bmatrix}\)，\(d\)为视距
principle_desc_en: A projection method in which projection lines originate from a single point (the projection center), pass through the object, and are projected onto the projection plane. The resulting view is called a central projection. Mathematically, the projection transformation matrix contains a perspective component, such as \(\begin{bmatrix}x'\\y'\\z'\end{bmatrix} = \frac{d}{z}\begin{bmatrix}x\\y\\z\end{bmatrix}\), where \(d\) is the viewing distance.

principle_desc_cn: 投影线相交于一点，形成透视效果，近大远小，几何特性：平行线在投影中交于灭点，如铁轨投影
principle_desc_en: The projection lines intersect at a single point, creating a perspective effect: objects closer appear larger, while those farther away appear smaller. Geometric characteristic: parallel lines converge at a vanishing point in the projection, as in the projection of railway tracks.

principle_desc_cn: 一种投影方法，其中投影线相互平行，经过物体后投射到投影面上，形成的视图称为平行投影，数学描述：正投影矩阵为\(\begin{bmatrix}1&0&0\\0&1&0\\0&0&0\end{bmatrix}\)，斜投影保留z轴倾斜分量
principle_desc_en: A projection method in which the projection lines are parallel to each other and, after passing through the object, are projected onto the projection plane. The resulting view is called a parallel projection. Mathematically, the orthographic projection matrix is \(\begin{bmatrix}1&0&0\\0&1&0\\0&0&0\end{bmatrix}\), and the oblique projection retains the inclined component along the z-axis.

principle_desc_cn: 投影线平行，物体各部分的尺寸按比例缩小，保持形状不变，如正投影维持直角性，斜投影保持平行性
principle_desc_en: The projection lines are parallel, and the dimensions of each part of the object are reduced proportionally, maintaining the shape unchanged. For example, orthographic projection preserves right angles, and oblique projection preserves parallelism.

principle_desc_cn: 一种投影方法，用于绘制物体的立体图或工程图，属于平行投影的一种，其特点是将物体沿着倾斜的方向投影到投影面上，保持x轴与z轴变形系数为1，y轴变形系数为0.5，轴间角为\(90^\circ\)（x-z）、\(135^\circ\)（x-y与z-y），数学表达：投影矩阵\(\begin{bmatrix}1&0&0\\0&0.5&0\\0&0&1\end{bmatrix}\)，倾斜角45°
principle_desc_en: A projection method used to draw three-dimensional views or engineering drawings of objects, which belongs to parallel projection. Its characteristic is projecting the object onto the projection plane along an oblique direction, keeping the deformation coefficients of the x-axis and z-axis as 1, the deformation coefficient of the y-axis as 0.5, and the angles between axes as \(90^\circ\) (x-z), \(135^\circ\) (x-y and z-y). The mathematical expression: projection matrix \(\begin{bmatrix}1&0&0\\0&0.5&0\\0&0&1\end{bmatrix}\), oblique angle 45°.

principle_desc_cn: 直观图能真实反映立体图形的形状和大小，数学条件：斜二测法中x/z轴保持实际尺寸，如正方体棱长\(a\)投影后仍为\(a\)
principle_desc_en: An intuitive diagram can accurately reflect the shape and size of a solid figure. Mathematical condition: In the oblique axonometric method, the x/z axes retain their actual dimensions; for example, after projection, the edge length \(a\) of a cube remains \(a\).

principle_desc_cn: 通过调整投影参数展示结构，公式：点\(P(x,y,z)\)投影为\(P'(x+ky\cosθ, z+ky\sinθ)\)
principle_desc_en: Displaying the structure by adjusting projection parameters, formula: the projection of point \(P(x,y,z)\) is \(P'(x+ky\cosθ, z+ky\sinθ)\)

principle_desc_cn: 可根据需求调整参数，如将y轴缩放因子k改为0.7，θ改为30°
principle_desc_en: Parameters can be adjusted as needed, such as changing the y-axis scaling factor k to 0.7 and θ to 30°.

kp_cn: 平面直角坐标系的定义
kp_en: Definition of Rectangular Coordinate System in Plane
principle_cn: 平面直角坐标系的定义
principle_desc_cn: 在同一个平面上互相垂直且有公共原点的两条数轴构成平面直角坐标系，简称直角坐标系（数学表示：原点\(O(0,0)\)，x轴单位向量\(\vec{i}\)，y轴单位向量\(\vec{j}\)，点坐标\(P(x,y)=x\vec{i}+y\vec{j}\)）
